background: A park is deciding on the number and type of trails to construct, with a focus on managing visitor capacity and minimizing environmental impact in terms of garbage production.
constraints: Number of wide trails is non-negative
Number of narrow trails is non-negative
Total visitors from wide trails does not exceed WideCapacity multiplied by the number of wide trails
Total visitors from narrow trails does not exceed NarrowCapacity multiplied by the number of narrow trails
Total number of trails does not exceed MaxWideTrails for wide trails
Total visitors every day does not exceed MaxCapacity
Total number of wide trails is an integer
Total number of narrow trails is an integer
objective: Minimize the total amount of garbage produced by the trails
description: A park is designing their trails and can either create a wide trail or a narrow trail. A wide trail can take \param{WideCapacity} visitors every day while the narrow trail expects \param{NarrowCapacity} visitors every day. The wide trail will introduce \param{WideGarbage} units of garbage and the narrow trail will introduce \param{NarrowGarbage} units of garbage. There can be at most \param{MaxWideTrails} wide trails and the park hopes to have at most \param{MaxCapacity} visitors every day. How many of each type of trail should the park construct to minimize the total amount of garbage produced.

parameters.definition: Visitor capacity per day for the wide trail
Visitor capacity per day for the narrow trail
Units of garbage introduced by one wide trail
Units of garbage introduced by one narrow trail
Maximum number of wide trails allowed
Maximum total visitor capacity per day
